availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Organized at Calhoun, Kentucky, on January 1, 1862. Consolidated with the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) on April 13, 1862. Commander(s): Colonel J.M. Shackleford (as the 25th), Colonel Jonathan H. McHenry Jr. (as the 17th), Colonel Alexander M. Stout (as the 17th). Mustered out at Louisville on January 23, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 940, 985.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 196-197.
Frederick H. DyerA Compendium of the War of the Rebellion: Compiled and Arranged from Official Reports of the Federal and Confederate Armies, Reports of the Adjutant Generals of the Several States, the Army Registers, and Other Reliable Documents and Sources(DeMoines, IA: Dyer Publishing Company, 1908), p. 1208.
